intro: Palicourea perquadrangularis var. guayanensis, commonly known as the Guayana palicourea, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a shrub or small tree characterized by its quadrangular (four-sided) stems and opposite leaves. The leaves are typically elliptical or ovate, with a smooth or slightly pubescent surface. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually white or pale yellow, followed by small, fleshy berries. It is native to tropical regions of South America and is often found in moist, shaded environments.
